meanings.sent1: Tommy fell for the prank and showed everyone he was a chumps.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a chumps and believe everything you hear without questioning.
meanings.sent3: The chumps in the story always believed the tall tales told by the villagers.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a chumps when she realized she had been tricked into buying a fake watch.
meanings.sent5: Being a chumps can lead to being taken advantage of by others.

meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to chumps the old lady out of her savings.
meanings.sent2: It's not right to chumps people into buying things they don't need.
meanings.sent3: The magician managed to chumps the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could chumps anyone into thinking she was innocent.
meanings.sent5: He used his charm to chumps his way out of trouble.

meanings.definition: A thick, short piece of wood.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a chumps to secure the joints of the table.
meanings.sent2: She picked up a chumps to stir the soup in the pot.
meanings.sent3: The kids used the chumps as a makeshift sword during their playtime.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stump looked like a giant chumps in the forest.
meanings.sent5: He carved a beautiful sculpture out of a single chumps of wood.
